meanings.definition: To sell a security that one does not own in the hope of buying it back at a lower price.
meanings.sent1: She was shorting the stock to make a profit.
meanings.sent2: He shorted the currency when he predicted a drop in value.
meanings.sent3: The investor was shorting the shares like a savvy trader.
meanings.sent4: Shorting the security felt like a risky move.
meanings.sent5: Shorting the stock was his strategy for gaining money.

meanings.definition: The act of betting against a particular security or asset.
meanings.sent1: His shorting of the company's stock surprised many.
meanings.sent2: Shorting can be a way to profit from a market decline.
meanings.sent3: The shorting of the asset raised eyebrows among investors.
meanings.sent4: The shorting of the security was a bold move.
meanings.sent5: The shorting of the stock was a risky bet.

meanings.definition: The act of reducing the length or duration of something.
meanings.sent1: The shorting of the meeting pleased everyone.
meanings.sent2: Shorting the movie made it more enjoyable for the audience.
meanings.sent3: The shorting of the playtime made the kids sad.
meanings.sent4: Shorting the speech made it more concise and impactful.
meanings.sent5: The shorting of the event saved time for all attendees.
